Introduction

This is the complete API documentation for the Learning Management System (LMS). The LMS API provides comprehensive endpoints for managing courses, users, orders, and student enrollments. The API is built with Express.js, MongoDB, and JWT authentication.

Version: 1.0.0

Documentation Date: February 2026

Base URL & Access

API Base URL

http://localhost:5000/api

Interactive API Documentation (Swagger UI)

http://localhost:5000/api-docs

üîê Authentication

JWT Bearer Token

All protected endpoints require a Bearer token in the Authorization header: 

Authorization: Bearer <your_access_token>

Getting Started

  1. Call the Sign Up endpoint to create an account or Sign In to authenticate
  2. Receive an accessToken (valid for 45 minutes) and refreshToken (valid for 7 days)
  3. Use the accessToken for subsequent API calls
  4. When accessToken expires, use the Refresh Token endpoint to get a new one

Token Expiry

Token Type Expiry Duration Usage
Access Token 45 minutes API requests
Refresh Token 7 days Get new access token

Response Format

All API responses follow a consistent JSON format.

Success Response

{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    // Response data
  },
  "message": "Optional success message"
}

Error Response

{
  "success": false,
  "status": "fail",
  "message": "Error description"
}

Error Codes

Code Status Meaning Action
200 OK Request succeeded No action needed
201 Created Resource created successfully No action needed
400 Bad Request Invalid request parameters Check request body
401 Unauthorized Missing or invalid token Refresh token and retry
403 Forbidden Insufficient permissions Check user role
404 Not Found Resource not found Verify resource ID
409 Conflict Resource already exists Check for duplicates
500 Server Error Internal server error Retry with exponential backoff

üîê Authentication Endpoints

1. Sign Up

POST /auth/signup

PUBLIC

Register a new user account.

Request Body

{
  "username": "john123",
  "email": "john@example.com",
  "phone": "0987654321",
  "password": "SecurePass123",
  "address": "123 Main St"
}

Response (201 Created)

{
  "success": true,
  "message": "ƒêƒÉng k√Ω th√†nh c√¥ng",
  "data": {
    "userId": "507f1f77bcf86cd799439011",
    "username": "john123"
  }
}

2. Sign In

POST /auth/signin

PUBLIC

Authenticate user and receive tokens.

Request Body

{
  "username": "john123",
  "password": "SecurePass123"
}

Response (200 OK)

{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "userId": "507f1f77bcf86cd799439011",
    "username": "john123",
    "role": "parent",
    "accessToken": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..."
  }
}

3. Refresh Token

POST /auth/refresh

PUBLIC

Get a new access token using refresh token.

Response (200 OK)

{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "accessToken": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..."
  }
}

4. Logout

POST /auth/logout

REQUIRES AUTH

Invalidate the current refresh token.

5. Logout All Devices

POST /auth/logout-all

REQUIRES AUTH

Logout from all devices by invalidating all refresh tokens.

üë§ User Endpoints

1. Get Current User Profile

GET /users/me

REQUIRES AUTH

Get the logged-in user's profile information.

Response (200 OK)

{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "_id": "507f1f77bcf86cd799439011",
    "username": "john123",
    "email": "john@example.com",
    "phone": "0987654321",
    "role": "parent",
    "createdAt": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z"
  }
}

2. Update User Profile

PUT /users/me

REQUIRES AUTH

Update current user's profile information.

Request Body

{
  "username": "john456",
  "email": "newemail@example.com",
  "phone": "0912345678"
}

3. Change Password

POST /users/change-password

REQUIRES AUTH

Change the current user's password.

Request Body

{
  "oldPassword": "OldPass123",
  "newPassword": "NewPass456"
}

4. Get Teachers List

GET /users/teachers

PUBLIC

Get list of all teachers.

5. Create User (Admin Only)

POST /users

REQUIRES AUTH ADMIN

Create a new user account.

6. Get All Users (Admin Only)

GET /users

REQUIRES AUTH ADMIN

Retrieve all users with optional filtering by role.

7. Get User by ID (Admin Only)

GET /users/:id

REQUIRES AUTH ADMIN

Get a specific user by ID.

8. Update User (Admin Only)

PUT /users/:id

REQUIRES AUTH ADMIN

Update any user's information.

9. Delete User (Admin Only)

DELETE /users/:id

REQUIRES AUTH ADMIN

Delete a user account.

üìö Course Endpoints

1. Get All Courses

GET /courses

PUBLIC

Get list of published courses with filtering and pagination.

Query Parameters

  • page - Page number (default: 1)
  • limit - Items per page (default: 10)
  • category - Filter by category (Opening, Strategy, Tactics, Endgame, General)
  • level - Filter by level (Beginner, Intermediate, Advanced, All Levels)
  • search - Search by title

2. Get Course Details

GET /courses/:id

PUBLIC

Get full details of a specific course.

3. Create Course (Admin Only)

POST /courses

REQUIRES AUTH ADMIN

Create a new course.

Request Body

{
  "title": "Advanced Chess Tactics",
  "description": "Master advanced tactical patterns",
  "price": 149.99,
  "salePrice": 119.99,
  "level": "Advanced",
  "category": "Tactics",
  "thumbnail": "https://example.com/image.jpg",
  "tags": ["tactics", "advanced"]
}

4. Get Managed Courses (Admin Only)

GET /courses/managed-courses

REQUIRES AUTH ADMIN

Get all courses managed by the current admin.

5. Update Course (Admin Only)

PUT /courses/:id

REQUIRES AUTH ADMIN

Update course information.

6. Delete Course (Admin Only)

DELETE /courses/:id

REQUIRES AUTH ADMIN

Delete a course (soft delete).

üí≥ Order Endpoints

1. Create Order

POST /orders

REQUIRES AUTH

Create a new order for purchasing courses.

Request Body

{
  "items": [
    {"courseId": "607f1f77bcf86cd799439015"},
    {"courseId": "607f1f77bcf86cd799439016"}
  ],
  "paymentMethod": "bank_transfer"
}

2. Get My Orders

GET /orders/my-orders

REQUIRES AUTH

Get all orders of the current user.

3. Cancel Order

PUT /orders/:id/cancel

REQUIRES AUTH

Cancel a pending order.

4. Mark Order as Paid (Admin Only)

PUT /orders/:id/pay

REQUIRES AUTH ADMIN

Mark an order as paid and create enrollments.

Request Body

{
  "transactionId": "TXN123456789"
}

üìñ Enrollment Endpoints

1. Get My Courses

GET /enrollments/my-courses

REQUIRES AUTH

Get all courses the user is enrolled in.

2. Get Course Progress

GET /enrollments/:courseId/progress

REQUIRES AUTH

Get learning progress for a specific course.

3. Revoke Enrollment (Admin Only)

PATCH /enrollments/:id/revoke

REQUIRES AUTH ADMIN

Remove a student's access to a course.

4. Get Course Students (Admin Only)

GET /enrollments/course/:courseId/students

REQUIRES AUTH ADMIN

Get list of students enrolled in a course.

üìö Chapter Endpoints

1. Get Course Chapters

GET /courses/:courseId/chapters

PUBLIC

Get all chapters in a course.

2. Create Chapter (Admin Only)

POST /chapters/:courseId

REQUIRES AUTH ADMIN

Create a new chapter in a course.

3. Update Chapter (Admin Only)

PUT /chapters/:id

REQUIRES AUTH ADMIN

Update chapter information.

4. Reorder Chapters (Admin Only)

PUT /chapters/reorder

REQUIRES AUTH ADMIN

Change the order of chapters in a course.

5. Delete Chapter (Admin Only)

DELETE /chapters/:id

REQUIRES AUTH ADMIN

Delete a chapter and its lessons.

üéì Lesson Endpoints

PUBLIC

2. Get Lesson Details

REQUIRES AUTH

Get a specific lesson (requires enrollment).

3. Create Lesson (Admin Only)

POST /lessons/chapter/:chapterId

REQUIRES AUTH ADMIN

Request Body

  "duration": 30
}

4. Update Lesson (Admin Only)

PUT /lessons/:id

REQUIRES AUTH ADMIN

Update lesson information.

5. Reorder Lessons (Admin Only)

PUT /lessons/reorder

REQUIRES AUTH ADMIN

Change the order of lessons in a chapter.

6. Delete Lesson (Admin Only)

DELETE /lessons/:id

REQUIRES AUTH ADMIN

Delete a lesson from a chapter.

üìù Validation Rules

Username

  • Minimum length: 3 characters
  • Maximum length: 50 characters
  • Unique in database
  • Alphanumeric and underscore allowed

Email

  • Must be valid email format
  • Unique in database
  • Lowercase converted

Phone

  • Format: Vietnamese (0 followed by 9-10 digits)
  • Unique in database
  • Example: 0987654321

Password

  • Minimum length: 6 characters
  • Stored as bcrypt hash
  • Never returned in responses

Course Price

  • Must be >= 0
  • Sale price must be <= original price

Enrollment Progress

  • Range: 0-100 (percentage)
  • Automatically calculated from completed lessons
